Package uk.ac.ebi.utils.threading.batchproc

Interface BatchCollector<B>

  • Type Parameters:
    B - the type of batch that the collector manages.
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    ItemizedBatchCollector<B,​E>, ItemizedSizedBatchCollector<B,​E>, SizedBatchCollector<B>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractSizedBatchCollector, CollectionBatchCollector, ListBatchCollector, SetBatchCollector
    public interface BatchCollector<B>
    ## The Batch Collector A batch collector is a container of methods to manage matches during the operations of BatchProcessor. This default interface offers a batch factory, used to obtain a new batch when needed, and a ready flag, which establishes if a batch is ready for being processed (eg, it's full wrt o a given size). Significant specific sub-interface are the sized-based collectors, the item-based one and their intersection. Due to some similarity, batch collectors are named after Java stream collectors.
    Author:
    brandizi
    Date:
    23 Nov 2019
